section.name: BooleanDiscriminator
section.p: A BooleanDiscriminator discriminates Booleans. With Java's auto-boxing feature, it doesn't matter whether Boolean objects or boolean values are present; this Discriminator will discriminate them. Because there are only two boolean values, the BooleanDiscriminator places each item in one of two buckets, for false and true.

section.name: Example

ul.li: {true, false, true, true, true, false, false, true, false, false}

section.p: ... a BooleanDiscriminator returns the following equivalence classes:
